analysis.Summary: Defines and exports the Vue Router configuration for the orders module, including routes for listing, creating, viewing, and editing orders in both frontend and backoffice contexts.
analysis.Purpose: Centralize the orders-related route definitions so they can be mounted under a parent path (e.g. '/orders') in the main application router.

Components.name: Orders
Components.role: Page component displaying a list of orders.

Components.name: OrderCreate
Components.role: Frontend page component for creating a new order.

Components.name: OrderCreateBackoffice
Components.role: Backoffice/admin page component for adding a new order.

Components.name: OrderBackoffice
Components.role: Backoffice page component for viewing or editing an existing order.

Functions.name: props (route => {...})
Functions.description: Generates the `mode` prop based on the route's meta.context to toggle between 'view' and 'edit' modes.

parameters.name: route
parameters.description: The current Vue Router route object.

analysis.Usage: Imported into the main router setup (e.g., `router/index.js`) and concatenated under the `/orders` parent route to register all order-related routes.
Notes: Each route defines a `meta.title` object with English and Russian translations.
Two creation routes: one for frontend users (`path: 'form'`) and one for backoffice admins (`path: 'add'`).
Dynamic prop function on the `:order` route reads `route.matched[0].meta.context` to decide the mode.
